title: Finding the Median from a Histogram: NBA Payroll
question_text:
This histogram below represents the average payroll of $29$ NBA teams. ;qsIn which bin is the median located?

Created for Albert.io. Copyright 2017. All rights reserved.
solution:
The median, in this case, is the $15$th value in the data set. In the first bin ($22\le \text{ payroll }<28$) the frequency is $12$, which means the first $12$ values are in that bin.

In the second bin ($28\le \text{ payroll }<34$) there are $5$ values in there which indicates the $13$th, $14$th, $15$th, $16$th, and $17$th value are in there.

Since the $15$th value is the median then the correct choice is Choice 'B'.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect as the first $12/29$ or $41.3$% of NBA teams are in the payroll. We need the cumulative relative frequency for $50$%.

Choices 'C', 'D', and 'E' are incorrect as the first value in each of those bins would already exceed $50$%.
